column4: im gunna update to a 64bit kernel, anyone know if i do that will i only be able to use ^$bit apps?
why doesnt root@UBunBOX:/home/sean # apt-cache search kernel image |grep 64
have you installed the amd64 version?
i can just use the 32bit version if the 64bit one wont allow me to run 32 bit apps
if you're running the amd64 version, you have a 64 bit kernel. if you're running the i386 version, you have a 32 bit kernel.
Is there a way to upgrade, and if i do can i still run 386 apps?
welcome to the development branch. expect bugs.
warty shipped with xfree86. it has not and will not be updated to use xorg. xorg is in hoary only.
I am using warty i will send you a file to prove it and i am also using x.org want my config?
not really, i'm happy to not believe you either way :)
howcome when i type my ip address in an html browser i can see the placeholder page but when i try quarupt.cjb.net i dont?
